question.title: Eclipse - error "org.w3c.dom is accessible from more than one module" when doing import
question.body:
I have an issue in Eclipse that does not reproduce with VS Code or Intellij.

When I import a certain package I get this error: The package org.w3c.dom is accessible from more than one module: <unnamed>, java.xml

This project works from VS Code, Intellij and builds from from CLI. But Eclipse struggles on this.

I hesitate to make any dep tree changes because Intellij and VS Code seem to not have this issue.

Is there some reason why Eclipse is having this issue that someone can trigger me to understand?

answers.body:
I went ahead and checked my dependency tree, and sure enough there was a conflicting java.xml module in there!

            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>xerces</groupId>
                    <artifactId>xercesImpl</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>xml-apis</groupId>
                    <artifactId>xml-apis</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>

I found the 2 offenders that added that (in my test scope), added those exclusions, working now.

Why does Intellij and VS Code code editors not complain about these lines, not sure.

question_comments.body: This is not an issue of Eclipse but a real issue of your code, as it violates the Java language specification: stackoverflow.com/a/53824670/6505250
yeah i was getting to posting that info at your request, and it led me to finding the answer. strange - why didn't intellij or vs code complain about this conflict? interesting
Is this project driven by Maven or Gradle? If so, post the configuration.

79727804.body: javac ignores this error as well, which is a confirmed bug. Some tools follow javac rather than the Java language specification. For details see: stackoverflow.com/a/53824670/6505250
